title: Plinko with Matter.js
description: I love all things random and chance so why not make a Plink simulation with the matter.js physics engine and p5.js!

timestamps.title: Introducing today's topic: a Plinko Simulation
Use Matter.js to create a Body
Use Prototype to show the particle
Use Engine.update() to update the particle position
Add bounce by adjusting restitution and friction
Shift every other row of the Plinkos
Remove particles that go off screen
Debug to make sure code is working
Adjust the density of the particles
Use the preload function to load a sound.mp3 file
Use Matter.Events to figure out when the particles hit the plinkos
Play a sound if there is a collision between a particle and a plinko
